name: Muhammad ibn Musa al-Khwarizmi
contribution: Developing the foundation of algebra and algorithms, advancing the fields of mathematics, astronomy, and geography, and creating the foundation for modern trigonometry

name: Ada Lovelace
contribution: Wrote the first algorithm for the Analytical Engine

name: Alan Turing
contribution: Developed the concept of a universal machine and laid the foundation for modern computer science

name: Grace Hopper
contribution: Invented the first compiler, which translated high-level programming language into machine code

name: Dennis Ritchie
contribution: Created the C programming language, which influenced the development of many other programming languages

name: Guido van Rossum
contribution: Created the Python programming language, emphasizing code readability

name: James Gosling
contribution: Invented Java, a widely-used programming language known for its platform independence

name: Brendan Eich
contribution: JavaScript, which allows the creation of interactive and dynamic web content. It is used for both front- and back-end Internet Programming and is a core component of modern web applications

name: Yukihiro Matsumoto
contribution: Ruby, which is a dynamic, open-source programming language that focuses on simplicity and productivity. It introduced the Ruby on Rails framework that made it easier to develop web applications quickly

name: Anders Hejlsberg
contribution: C# is a versatile, object-oriented language developed by Microsoft as part of the .NET framework. It has a wide array of applications including Windows applications, web services, and game development using Unity
